CatDescriptText: Russell Fallen, maintenance, Hill District and Marie Clay, government employee, Penn Hills, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, July 28, 1962, pg. 15 with question: "When do you think the Pirates will move into first place?"  Mr. Fallen's answer reads: "I'm not much of a baseball fan but I don't think they'll make it this year.  If they do, it will be a long, tough battle with the Dodgers and Giants after them all the way."  Mrs. Clay's answer reads: "Possibly next month.  I don't think they'll win the pennant though."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Russell Fallen wearing light colored suit jacket and sunglasses, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Marie Clay wearing light colored button down dress with belt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
